summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons internal affairs referral and a supporting memorandum regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. It details the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell and contains statements from two correctional officers admitting they failed to conduct required inmate checks (the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. rounds) prior to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer (GS-5) who was the subject of the internal affairs referral for being inattentive to duty. He was found performing CPR on Epstein and later stated 'we messed up' regarding the failure to conduct rounds.

persons.name: Tovia Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer (Material Handler Foreman, GS-5) who was the subject of the internal affairs referral. She reported the medical emergency and admitted to the Operations Lieutenant that she and Officer Thomas did not conduct the required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The BOP official who spoke with Officers Noel and Thomas after the incident, received their admissions about not conducting rounds, and authored the memorandum detailing the response to Epstein's medical emergency.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The CEO/Warden of MCC New York who signed off on the internal affairs referral document.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers assigned to the Special Housing Unit on the shift when Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive. They both admitted to failing to conduct required inmate rounds together.
Noel was the correctional officer who discovered Epstein unresponsive in his cell and reported the medical emergency.
Thomas was the correctional officer found performing CPR on the unresponsive Epstein in his cell.
The Operations Lieutenant conducted an interview with Officer Noel following the incident, during which she admitted to not completing inmate counts.
The Operations Lieutenant spoke with Officer Thomas after the incident, who admitted 'we messed up' regarding the failure to conduct rounds.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York at approximately 6:33 a.m. He was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. at a local hospital.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Inmate Rounds
events.description: Correctional Officers Tovia Noel and Michael Thomas admitted to an Operations Lieutenant that they did not conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds in the Special Housing Unit prior to Epstein being found unresponsive.

events.title: Internal Affairs Referral Initiated
events.description: A formal internal affairs referral was prepared regarding the incident, alleging the involved officers were 'inattentive to Duty' and demonstrated 'Failure to Follow Policy.'

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m. and was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m.
Two correctional officers, Tovia Noel and Michael Thomas, admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds on the shift when Epstein was found.
Officer Thomas was found performing CPR on Epstein when the Operations Lieutenant arrived at the cell.
The officers stated they were 'traumatized' by the incident and wanted to contact their union president before writing any required memorandums about the event.
A Bureau of Prisons internal affairs investigation was initiated based on allegations of 'inattentive to Duty' and 'Failure to Follow Policy' against the two officers.
